sourceText: When we model peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved.
text: When we model peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved.

sourceText: Positive language, active listening, and empathy help maintain a peaceful and happy family environment under stressful times.
text: Positive language, active listening, and empathy help maintain a peaceful and happy family environment under stressful times.

sourceText: Use positive language. It works!
text: Use positive language. It works!

sourceText: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”.
text: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don’t want them to do: Instead of “Stop shouting,” try “Please speak more quietly”.

sourceText: Praise others to make them feel appreciated and good about themselves. Simple words like, “Thank you for clearing the dinner,” or “Thank you for watching the baby” can make a big difference.
text: Praise others to make them feel appreciated and good about themselves. Simple words like, “Thank you for clearing the dinner,” or “Thank you for watching the baby” can make a big difference.

sourceText: Share the load.
text: Share the load.

sourceText: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared.
text: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it’s much easier when responsibilities are shared.

sourceText: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.
text: Try to share household chores, childcare, and other tasks equally amongst family members.

sourceText: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household.
text: Create a schedule for time “on” and time “off” with other adults in your household.

sourceText: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.
text: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.

sourceText: Feeling stressed or angry?
text: Feeling stressed or angry?

sourceText: Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly five times. Then try to respond in a calmer way. Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.
text: Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly five times. Then try to respond in a calmer way. Millions of parents say this helps - A LOT.

sourceText: Decide to take a break from arguing when you see arguments building up, and go into another room or outside if you can.
text: Decide to take a break from arguing when you see arguments building up, and go into another room or outside if you can.

sourceText: Be an empathetic active listener.

sourceText: Listen to others when they are talking with you.

sourceText: Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying.
text: Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying.

sourceText: It can help to summarise what you have heard before responding: “What I hear you saying is…”.

sourceText: Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children.
